actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow for a temporary period a tax credit equal to one-half of the increase in residential electricity expenses occurring after January 1, 1973.

summary.text: Fuel Adjustment Relief Act - States that there shall be allowed as a tax credit against income tax an amount equal to 50 percent of the increased residential electricity expenses paid or incurred by the taxpayer during the taxable year. Prescribes a method for computing for the taxable year the increased residential electricity expenses. States that the credit authorized by this Act shall apply to calendar years 1974 through 1978.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow for a temporary period a tax credit equal to one-half of the increase in residential electricity expenses occurring after January 1, 1973.
